SVGGeometryElement.summary: The SVGGeometryElement interface represents SVG elements whose rendering is defined by geometry with an equivalent path, and which can be filled and stroked. This includes paths and the basic shapes.

SVGGeometryElementPathLength.summary:
The SVGGeometryElement.pathLength property reflects the
pathLength attribute and returns the total length of the path, in user units.

SVGGeometryElementGetPointAtLength.summary:
The
SVGGeometryElement.getPointAtLength() method returns the
point at a given distance along the path.
SVGGeometryElementGetPointAtLength.returns: A indicating the point at a given distance along the path.

SVGGeometryElementIsPointInFill.summary: The isPointInFill() method of the interface determines whether a given point is within the fill shape of an element. The point argument is interpreted as a point in the local coordinate system of the element.
SVGGeometryElementIsPointInFill.returns: A boolean indicating whether the given point is within the fill or not.

SVGGeometryElementIsPointInStroke.summary: The isPointInStroke() method of the interface determines whether a given point is within the stroke shape of an element. The point argument is interpreted as a point in the local coordinate system of the element.
SVGGeometryElementIsPointInStroke.returns: A boolean indicating whether the given point is within the stroke or not.

SVGGeometryElementGetTotalLength.summary:
The SVGGeometryElement.getTotalLength() method returns
the user agent's computed value for the total length of the path in user units.
SVGGeometryElementGetTotalLength.returns: A float indicating the total length of the path in user units.
